Class JPEditWindow

java.lang.Object
javafx.stage.Window
javafx.stage.Stage
com.tom.jpedit.gui.DependableStage
com.tom.jpedit.gui.JPEditWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.event.EventTarget
public class JPEditWindow extends DependableStage
This class represents a text editor window of JPEdit

These windows contain all the JavaFX controls that the window contains including those for plugins that are loaded.

It also contains state regarding save files, autosave workers, autosave state and whether the text area is dirty (unsaved) or not.

The window can be duplicated with all its properties.

Because it expends DependableStage stages can depend on JPEditWindows. Stages that depend on a DependableStage must close if the DependableStage closes. See the documentation for DependableStage for more

  • Property Details

    • dirty

      public javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyBooleanProperty dirtyProperty
      This property indicates if the TextArea is dirtied

      This is a ReadOnlyProperty but it can be watched. It is true if the TextArea has been changed since the last save.

      See Also:
      • isDirty()
      • dirtyProperty()

  • Method Details

    • wasDirtied

      public void wasDirtied()
      Marks the window as dirty. Setter does not exist because unmarking should be up to the JPEditWindow

    • dirtyProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyBooleanProperty dirtyProperty()
      This property indicates if the TextArea is dirtied

      This is a ReadOnlyProperty but it can be watched. It is true if the TextArea has been changed since the last save.

      Returns:
      the Dirty Property of the JPEditWindow
      See Also:
      • isDirty()

    • actionControlMap

      @NotNull public static @NotNull Map<Action,javafx.event.EventTarget> actionControlMap()

    • turnAutoSaveOn

      public void turnAutoSaveOn()
      Sets the autoSaveEnabled to true

    • turnAutoSaveOff

      public void turnAutoSaveOff()
      Sets autoSaveEnabled to false

    • terminateAutoSaveWorker

      public void terminateAutoSaveWorker() throws ExecutionException, InterruptedException
      Sets the autoSaveEnabled to false, cancels the Future and shuts down the executor, and deletes the temporary file created by autosave worker Auto-save cannot be turned back on once this method is called.
      Throws:
      ExecutionException
      InterruptedException

    • getTempSaveFileName

      public String getTempSaveFileName()
      Get the name of the temporary file that is used by the AutoSaveWorker to autosave the file
      Returns:
      the name of the temporary autosave file

    • getId

      public int getId()

    • populateRecentItems

      public void populateRecentItems()
      Updates the list of recent files in the file menu according to the record of recent files that the application maintains

    • updateTitleForSave

      public void updateTitleForSave()
      Display the saved file name in the title bar if it exists

    • duplicate

      @Nullable public @Nullable JPEditWindow duplicate(JPEditWindow intoWindow)
      Duplicates the JPEditWindow making all settings in the new window equal to the settings of the originating window.

      If the originating window has been saved, the duplicated window must also be saved before preceding. Otherwise the window will duplicate without asking for a save

      Returns:
      a new JPEditWindow with all the same settings and text

    • fire

      public void fire(Action action)
      Fires an action from Action on the window. This triggers an ActionEvent that is fired on this Window
      Parameters:
      action - the action to fire on this window

    • hasSaveFile

      public boolean hasSaveFile()
      Returns true if the Window has a save file meaning the window has been saved at least once.

      A save file is just the file to which the text has been saved. This allows the "Save" action to save to the existing file and not prompt with a FileChooser.

      Returns:
      true if the window has a save file

    • newFile

      public void newFile()
      Create a new file without checking if the file has been saved

      This method creates a new file by 1) clearing the TextArea, 2) setting the save file to null and setting the window as dirty.

      This method will NOT prompt to save ever!

    • saveUpdated

      public void saveUpdated()
      This method sets dirty to false and updates the save label to the current time

      This method turns sets dirty to false meaning no save prompts will be issued until the window is dirtied again and updates the save label

    • isFullPathInTitle

      public boolean isFullPathInTitle()
      Returns true if the full path to the open Save File is displayed in the title bar and false otherwise
      Returns:
      true if the full path to the open Save File is displayed in the title bar and false otherwise
